alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 10 at 6:40PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTRY MIX TO CONTINUE FOR THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA AND NUNIVAK ISLAND THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... A wintry mix of light to moderate snow, occasionally mixed with rain is expected to continue through early Friday morning for Nunivak Island and the Kuskokwim Delta coast. Temperatures are expected to be in the low 30s throughout the time period. Highest snow accumulations are expected to be around Nunivak Island (Mekoryuk) and the northern Kuskokwim Delta coast (Toksook Bay/Newtok) with lower accumulations expected further south (Chefornak/Kipnuk) where warmer air intrudes. Further inland around Bethel, light freezing rain or freezing drizzle, occasionally mixed with rain, will continue until around midnight tonight before precipitation ends. Ice accumulations of up to a glaze are possible. Temperatures are expected to continue to warm overnight into the mid 30s with a transition to mostly rain expected for Thursday. There is potential for cold air to nudge back in for Thursday evening for another potential brief round of rain/snow mix before ending early Friday morning.
